content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), df[:dt])
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as an argument and adds a new column `:ym` to it. The values in this new column are the year-month strings extracted from the DateTime column `:dt`. 

Please note that you need to have the DataFrames package installed in your Julia environment for this code to work. If it's not, you can install it using Pkg.add("DataFrames").
